assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
XSD is included in 2 national catalogues of recommended specifications. They belong to the Netherlands and Spain. The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of these Member States is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.
See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
XSD 1.1 is supporting the second level of maturity of Tim Berners-Lee's 5-stars schema for open data. It eases the availability of the data and structures XML files. Additionally, XSD 1.1 is implied within the RDF 1.1 XML Syntax, used for the serialisation of RDF documents as XML. Therefore, XSD fosters the publication of data as Open Data. 
See: 
https://5stardata.info/en/
https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf-syntax-grammar/

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
W3C has a defined and publicly available Process for the Development and approval process of the specification as a recommended standard. Also, a clear Release Notes tracking the changes of the different versions is archived.

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/2018/Process-20180201/#Policies

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
W3C has a defined and publicly available Process for the Development and approval process of the specification as a recommended standard, including a public review.

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/2018/Process-20180201/#Policies

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
XSD 1.1 is publicly available for implementation and study for free on W3C's webpage. 

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-1/ https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-2/

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
The W3C Royalty-Free IPR licenses granted under the W3C Patent Policy apply to all W3C specifications, including XSD.

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/patent-practice#ref-AC

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
The W3C Royalty-Free IPR licenses granted under the W3C Patent Policy apply to all W3C specifications, including XSD.

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/patent-practice#ref-AC

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: The version which is being assessed was released in 2012, fact that demonstrates the maturity of the specification for its use in the development of products and services. Moreover, XSD is an open specification supported by products and services and it is involved in the development of web services as XML schemas are needed for validating XML files.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: XSD 1.1 is an Open specification which is implied in the validation of XML documents. As XML is a de-facto standard implied in in the creation of solutions, including innovative ones, XSD is also fostering the creation of innovative solutions.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
XSD 1.1 is maintained by W3C which is an international community developing open standards. 

See:
https://www.w3.org/Consortium/
https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-1/ 
 https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-2/

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: As XML is used to encode all communications all over the internet, XSD fosters the visibility and comprehensibility of administrations by providing validation of exchanged data.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: By means of validating if XML files are conformant with the schema established, the specification helps to ensure the availability of internal information systems of public administrations. It is worth to note that it is possible due to the fact that XML is used to encode communications over the internet.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: XSD is a business domain agnostic specification that can be used at any business domain.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
XSD is maintained by W3C which is an international community developing open standards. 
See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-1/ https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-2/

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: XSD 1.1 is an open specification that can be used independently from other technologies or platforms. However, XSD 1.1 is defining datatypes which depend on definitions in XML and Namespaces in XML. This fact is not hampering the adoption of XSD as XML is worldwide adopted.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: XSD 1.1 allows to define schemas according with specific needs, which allow citizens, businesses or administrations to create schemas. The creation of schemas eases the creation of XML complying with requirements for specific or general purposes. Thus, the implementation of XML schemas do not hamper the interoperability and scalability of systems.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: XSD provides schemas for the validation of XML and the proper data exchange by means of it. Therefore, by ensuring the well formation and validity of the documents being exchanged, XSD fosters the data portability between systems and administrations across borders.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: By defining schemas for XML documents, which are involved in the data exchange across borders, XSD ensures and eases the implementation of the once-only principle.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: The purpose of XSD 1.1 is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: By establishing constraints on the creation and exchange of XML documents XSD fosters the trustworthy data exchange between administrations and stakeholders. However, XSD does not include security features in itself. Despite this, XML includes several recommendations in order to ensure the security of data and users.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: The purpose of XSD 1.1 is not related to delivery of multilingual European public services. Therefore this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: By ensuring that XML files are well formed and valid, XSD fosters the digital exchange of information between administrations and stakeholders. At the same time, it avoid the non-digital information exchange helping to the reduction of administrative burdens.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: The purpose of XSD 1.1 is not related to long-term preservation of electronic documents. Therefore this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
There are already studies and documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency. The topics are different, for instance, there is a study assessing the capabilities of XML Schema for the defense against Signature Wrapped Attacks. 
Another field of documentation is the XML Schema clustering, and its effectiveness for the improvement of user results.
See: 
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/252053794_On_the_effectiveness_of_XML_Schema_validation_for_countering_XML_Signature_Wrapping_attacks
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/254858700_XML_schema_matching_balancing_efficiency_and_effectiveness_by_means_of_clustering

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
XSD is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). Specifically, XSD can define the interoperability aspects of the "Data Syntax" ABBs of the EIRA Semantic View.
See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
There are existing mechanisms for assessing the conformity of XSD implementations. W3C provides with a XSD test suit that is available for free. 
See: 
https://github.com/w3c/xsdtests

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
8 Member States are recommending XSD in their ICT National Catalogues. 

See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
XSD is widely used when exchanging information in XML is needed. There are two european initiatives that are using XSD to provide services. 

The first initiative is TED eSentool, a free web service of the Publications Office which is focused in allow eSenders to follow-up the process of their notices until publication. 

The ESPD, is another cross border initiative using XSD for the validation of the XML documents generated while generating eProcurement process and documentation.  

See: 
https://esentool.ted.europa.eu/
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/single-market/public-procurement/digital/espd

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
The specification is included in 10 Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications. Some examples of Member States including XSD on their catalogues are the Netherlands, Slovenia, Spain or Portugal.

See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: At the moment of performing the assessment, the specification is not included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: The specification is included within the European Single Procurement Document (ESPD) initiative, which is a cross border initiative that aims to simplify the steps when procuring public contracts. The initiative has been running since years ago, and although is not mandatory to use, Member States acting as contracting authorities are able to publish tenders. These tenders can be applied across borders. Therefore, it can be considered as an interoperability agreement between public administrations at supra-national level.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: After carrying out an exhaustive search, no evidence has been found regarding XSD 1.1 compliance with the European Regulation on Standardisation.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: The purpose of XSD 1.1 is not related to business processes modelling. Therefore this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement: The purpose of XSD 1.1 is not related to define organisational interoperability aspects. Therefore this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification.

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
XSD 1.1 is defining the schema and datatypes in order to define and constraint the structures and content included in XML files. Moreover, XSD 1.1 is describing an abstract data model which provides details on the schema definition. Therefore, XSD is defining a cross-sector reusable data model. 
See: 
https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-1/

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
XSD 1.1 is supporting the second level of maturity of Tim Berners-Lee's 5-stars schema for open data. It eases the availability of the data and structures XML files. Additionally, XSD 1.1 is implied within the RDF 1.1 XML Syntax, used for the serialisation of RDF documents as XML. Therefore, XSD fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data. 

Moreover, although XSD is not related directly with Open Vocabularies, it can be found included within the Linked Open Vocabularies. It is possible because datatypes defined by XSD are commonly used as rdfs:range by properties. 

See: 
https://5stardata.info/en/
https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf-syntax-grammar/
https://lov.linkeddata.es/dataset/lov/vocabs/xsd

assessment_title: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
P1: XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1. Part 1 and 2.
statement:
XSD 1.1 is publically available at the European Platform for the reuse of ICT solutions, Joinup. 
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/w3c-xml-schema-definition-language-xsd-11-part-2-datatypes
